greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Xor-Moebius transform of A156552.
comment: Unique sequence satisfying SumXOR_{d divides n} a(d) = A156552(n) for all n > 0, where SumXOR is the analog of summation under the binary XOR operation. See A295901 for a list of some of the properties of the Xor-Moebius transform.
The ordinary Möbius transform of A156552 is given in A297112.
It seems that A091629 gives the fixed points of this sequence.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..2048
program: A064989(n) = {my(f); f = factor(n); if((n>1 && f[1,1]==2), f[1,2] = 0); for (i=1, #f~, f[i,1] = precprime(f[i,1]-1)); factorback(f)};
A297106(n) = { my(v=0); fordiv(n, d, if(issquarefree(n/d), v=bitxor(v, A156552(d)))); (v); } \\ after code in A295901.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Dec 25 2017
